DescriptionText.Text: Short-order cook, infamous for his greasy fries and dried-up grilled cheese sandwiches.
Eccentric historian, best known for his collection of antique dictionaries.
Chatty stylist that just got her cosmetology certificate from the local community college.
Used to run the Tartan Mart in Spencer's Mill.
Designed Marshall's most famous buildings.
Learned electrical work from her mom. Learned medical work from Uncle Sam.
Cross country cyclist who made the mistake of pit-stopping in Marshall.
A meathead who's more concerned about the lack of football than he is about the zombies.
Still can't wrap her head around what's going on.
Specializes in Mexican/Indian fusion cuisine.
Efficient and thorough with little patience for bullshit.
Her parents hated her boyfriend... until the zombies got them.
Has worked at the local drugstore for 30 years.
Has a little land just west of Spencer's Mill.
Always wanted to quit her job, but definitely not like this.

NameText.Notes: Stole appearance from 147 GENERIC Virginia Dahlgren.

DescriptionText.Text: Always thinks he can do it better than you.
Was in her senior year of college.
Marshall's resident stoner.
A wealthy museum curator from Danforth.
Makes a mean stroganoff.
A lawyer from the city who happened to be in Marshall when shit went down.
Owner, sole waitress, and part-time cook at the Fork In the Road Diner.
Grew up in a rough-and-tumble part of Chicago, but he'll be damned if he'll let that stand in his way.
Comic book nerd who insists on being called "Lex." No one listens.
Mild-mannered treasurer for the town of Marshall.
Classically trained ballet dancer from Danforth. Dancing is his life.
Obsessed with anything sports related.
Will never ask "You want fries with that?" again.
Amateur photographer that sells the occasional shot to small magazines.
Famous for his sausage.
He's a whiz with a gun, and the dozens of taxidermied animals on his wall prove it.
Local high school English teacher.
In charge of demolitions at the local construction company.
Never did ask out that girl from the car dealership.
Her first emergency call resulted in her entire team's death.
One of the first responders to the Marshall food riots.
Bike messengers don't get a lot of work in small towns.
Used to train race horses.
Everybody in town called her "Crazy Marley."
Has a head full of useless knowledge.
Loves the great outdoors.
Built his house with his own two hands.
Took karate to get revenge on everybody who made fun of him in high school.
Once punched a bear in the face. So he says.
Insists that if you can kill it, you can fry it, and if you can fry it, you can eat it.
A wild and crazy guy.
A problem solver.
Surprised he hasn't French-kissed a shotgun yet.
Drove a big rig on the Danforth/Chicago route.
Thinks this whole thing is kind of fascinating, if you think about it.
Why does he call everybody "Boss?"
Damn good shot.
Thinks he's God's gift to everybody.
Whatever you do, don't tell him wrestling is staged.
Left the family farm to pursue a (hopeless) music career.
Could snap at any time.
Honorably discharged for a bum knee.
Was working on an article about the death of small-town America.
Thinks he's hard.
Hates this town and everyone in it. Posers.
A real cheery dearie.
Mistakenly thought the World Stroganoff Cookoff was in town.
Once built a steam-powered corn husker.
If it doesn't come in the form of a folksy saying, Janet doesn't trust it.
Had one guest star role on that sitcom with the talking dog 15 years ago.
Cries for days if she stubs her toe.
Dreamed of playing major league ball. Too bad he sucks at it.
Always manages to get in over his head.
Can't think of one distinctive thing about this guy.
Don't let her get started.
Don't mention clowns around him.
Thinks he's cursed.
Makes the best chicken soup in the valley.
Good in a tight spot, but freaks out if he can't get a drink.
Builds houses for the poor.
Smartest guy I know.
Not as racist as he seems.
If he offers to show you a trick, say no.
Claims he saw Bigfoot once.
Restores classic cars. Don't ask about his first name.
Runs a conspiracy theory blog.
Grows soybeans and corn.
Inherited lots of land, but his love of bourbon bankrupted him...and makes sure he stays that way.
Was hot shit in high school but never progressed beyond that.
Retired dentist who now owns a small farm in Spencer's Mill.
The man loves cars.
Local diner waitress.
Owner of a funky art gallery just outside of town.
Owner of the local mortuary.
Hits the bottle a little too hard.
Micro-brewer who left the big city to open a small pub in town.
Head of the county's Department of Transportation.
Skilled rider who shows horses at the county fair.
A dirty rotten scoundrel.
Long-time Marshall garbage man who hoards useful stuff that people throw away.
Just some thug. He doesn't even know how to describe himself.
Local charity worker and activist.
Local in over his head.
Feels responsible for maintaining some semblance of order in Trumbull County.
About as big-hearted and generous as they come. If it were up to him, he'd hand out all the food in the store to anybody who needed it; that's just what people do in a crisis, right?
The Friend: Local boy who moved off to the big city, but still comes back to visit every year.
The Convict: As far as Sam is concerned, Trumbull Valley and just about everyone in it can suck her dick.
The Gunner: He's the kind of guy you know will have your back, even if you've treated him like shit. Logged hundreds of hours at the shooting range.
The Veteran: Here in the valley for a hunting trip with some old Army buddies. A veteran sharpshooter.
The Sacrifice: Since the outbreak, he has been tasked with maintaining some semblance of order in Trumbull County. Has access to an artillery site in the mountains nearby.
The Ninja: We're pretty sure that isn't his real name. But we're afraid to say anything. You never know when he might be standing behind you.
The Mercenary: A few weeks ago, this was not the kind of guy you wanted to see knocking at your door. Now ... it's a relief to have him around. Him and his land mines.
The Scientist: He was sent in to research this disease and find a few answers. Now all he wants to do is find a way out. His hazmat suit is the ultimate defense against freak attacks.
The Grenadier: Used to blow stuff up in his backyard with a buddy. Never thought he'd get to do it for a living!
The Judge: A strict enforcer of the law whose reputation as a hanging judge has only added to her credibility as a leader in the aftermath of the outbreak.
The Bruiser: The youngest Wilkerson brother. A reckless hoodlum with a bigass wrench.
The Enthusiast: Her friends used to make fun of her annual trip to the Renaissance Faire. They're not laughing anymore.
The Hero: Just came to Trumbull Valley for a fishing trip. An imposing guy who knows how to swing an oar.
The Hunter: The hunter has become the hunted. And then the hunter again. It's complicated. This guy can shoot.
The Sniper: The oldest Wilkerson brother. He's a psychopathic son of a bitch. Can snipe zombies for you from across the map.
The Cop: Used to pantomime fighting zombies in his basement with a video camera. Now it's his full-time job.
The Rebel: She's been hiding from the authorities for years. Hiding from zombies shouldn't be a problem. Knows her way around an AK-47.
The Host: She was right there in Danforth when all hell broke loose.
The Tragedy: A good kid, but a little flaky.
The Phoenix: As bad as the situation is, in a way Becca welcomes it. The end of the world is an opportunity to forget the past and move on, and she's ready to become a new person.
The Killer: Alan has been a forest ranger with the Department of Fish and Wildlife since he graduated from community college.
The Survivor: The middle Wilkerson brother. A cold-blooded schemer, and a sneaky bastard.
The Believer: Heads up the church in Spencer's Mill. Good at building up our spirits, even in the darkest of times.
The Father: Local carpenter, one of the first to help organize survivors. Great with any kind of repairs.
The Healer: An old country doctor who knows everyone in Trumbull Valley, inside and out.
The Biker: Can fix just about anything... as long as he's got a steady supply of whiskey.
The Gardener: She's been learning to grow and store her own food for years, waiting for the end times to come.
The Mother: Zombie apocalypse? Whatever. Try raising five kids.
The Scholar: Direct descendant of Ezekiel Marshall himself. Spends a lot of time in the library, reading about it. Great at research.
The Fighter: Used to play one of the zombies in an annual "zombie run" event. Doesn't seem quite so funny anymore. At least she's in great shape.

The Mentor: Comes across as a quiet, patient, introspective sort. He's a long-time veteran of the force, and the department frequently partnered him up with rookies, trusting him to show them the ropes.
The Taskmaster: Demands nothing but the best from herself and those around her. Her subordinates privately call her the Monster for her mercilessly high standards.
The Dealer: Former county commissioner. Slick bastard. Good at procuring whatever you need ... especially if it's a car.
The Dead Man: Ol' Andy Pimms.
The Lifeline: Probably the most important person in our little community. Holds vast encyclopaedic knowledge. Used to be an architect.
Tasked with maintaining some semblance of order in Trumbull County.
Tasked with maintaining some semblance of order in Trumbull County.
Merc Gun
Merc Gun
Merc Gun
Merc Melee
Tasked with maintaining some semblance of order in Trumbull County.
Tasked with maintaining some semblance of order in Trumbull County.

The Commander: Transferred to the Military Police stateside after being cleared of a friendly-fire incident. Never wanted to hold the lives of her fellow soldiers in her hands again. Now all bets are off.
The Defender: A compassionate leader with a lot of on-the-ground experience down range. Has three daughters back in Hawaii.
The Joker: Didn't survive a hurricane in Louisiana to be killed by this shit. Laughs in the face of disaster, because what else can you do?
The Operator: We found him on some kind of weird black ops mission, and he doesn't seem to like us all that much. That's fine, the feeling's mutual.

The Prodigal: Used to be a wild child in college, but confronting the outbreak has sparked a return to the faith of her youth. She meditates daily and commits herself to personal discipline and service to others.
Wasn't as cut out for the military life as his brother. Took his demolitions training home to work in the coal mines ... and occasionally on bank vaults.
This heroic survivor wanted to be a part of your community because of your legendary accomplishments.
Supplies a bonus when assigned to a kitchen
Improved research
Can't we all just get along?
Can call in support from off-map artillery when a part of the community.
Can support other characters with sniper fire when a part of the community.
Can call in backup from a SWAT team when a part of the community.
Can be called in for words of inspiration when a part of the community.
Can be called in to advise on field medicine when a part of the community.
Can be called to deliver a vehicle when a part of the community.
Can call in an incendiary barrage from an off-map mortar site when a part of the community.
Can call in support from off-map artillery when a part of the community.
Can call in drone recon support.
Can call in offensive support from an overhead drone.
I was always the 'sick kid' growing up. I felt helpless. Well, I'm still sick, but I'm not helpless. If you run into trouble out there, just remember: I'm listening.
I used to crunch numbers, but now I'm crunching skulls. Never saw that coming.
If I'd ever gotten my big break, I wouldn't have been here when everything went to hell. (Knows how to strike a pose.)
If I'd known this was coming, I'd have designed the school with a moat. (Handy with tools.)
I've seen some fucked-up shit, believe me. (Good in an infirmary)
I woulda made a break for it, but I couldn't just leave all my tools behind. (Handy with tools.)
Tell you one thing: I'd be welcome in any community. With these things roaming around, everyone could use a drink. (Can cook.)
All that rotten flesh... God, it turns my stomach. (Can cook.)
It isn't just about fuel for your body. A good meal can nourish the soul. (Good cook.)
There's only so much I can do without fresh ingredients. (Great cook.)
Is it wrong to think this is better than my shitty old job?
Law and order. That was my life. Now there's no law and no order, but I'm still a cop at heart. (Improved Shooting.)
Not many people feel like dancing right now. Things are just too goddamn depressing. (Improved cardio.)
Buildings go up. It's my job to make them come down. (Chemistry know-how.)
Let me know if you want something to go boom. (Chemistry know-how.)
A zombie apocalypse is no excuse for poor oral hygiene. Are you flossing? (Some medical knowledge.)
First, do no harm. (Medical knowledge.)
Just need a little fuel and some generators, and I'm your new best friend. (Handy with tools.)
Don't take this the wrong way, but it's a really interesting problem to solve, if you think about it. (Handy with tools.)
No matter how fucked up things get, we have to plan for the coming season. (Good with plants.)
With the right people for the job, we can do anything. (Handy with tools.)
I've run eighty yard touchdowns without even breaking a sweat. (Sports trivia whiz.)
Dead people are walking around now? There goes my business. (Counseling experience.)
So many priceless pieces of art destroyed. It breaks my heart. (Sales experience.)
I've hauled some nasty shit in my days, but I never thought I'd be dragging around dead fucking bodies.
When they figure out who's responsible for this epidemic, there's going to be one hell of a lawsuit filed against them. (Jurisprudence expertise.)
There are a lotta hungry mouths out there, human and... otherwise. Lotta hungry mouths.
I figure there isn't a thing on this earth I don't know how to fix. Just get me some duct tape. (Handy with tools.)
Ezekiel Marshall would roll over in his grave if he could see this town now. (Research experience.)
I'm glad the zombies don't seem to have an interest in eating animals. I guess that's one good thing about this mess.
You didn't realize until now what those years at the academy were REALLY for. (Improved Shooting, Fighting, and Leadership.)
Kind of makes you miss the days of car accidents and heart attacks. (Medical knowledge.)
Listen, I don't just fill the bottles. I've got a Doctor of Pharmacy degree. (Medical knowledge.)
Hey, I don't look at your ass when YOU bend over. (Handy with tools.)
Tested my faith? It's reinforced it. (Counseling experience.)
Situation like this, you wish there were orders to follow. (Improved Shooting and Fighting.)
Well, at least I won't have to worry about paying off my school loans.
You learn a lot about human nature doing people's hair. My number one takeaway? We're doomed. (Counseling experience.)
I... the things I saw. I try not to think about my students. Sometimes I succeed... for a minute or two. (Counseling experience.)
So what if I didn't have a job? Like it matters now anyways.
I swear my old manager used to set the schedule just to mess with us. I don't miss that. (Street smarts.)
What can I do? Well, I can make you a website on... paper? Yeah, not an ideal career path for the apocalypse, I guess. (Computer skills.)
You can't say exactly who you worked for, or in which country ... but let's say you picked up a few ... specialized skills. (Advanced Shooting and Fighting.)
Went through the same training gauntlet that shapes every new soldier. Came out with essential combat and survival skills, and the ability to jog all day carrying a full pack.
Went through the intensive training in marksmanship and decision-making that defines a qualified sniper.
Spent years training in a variety of Martial Arts disciplines. Benefits as much from the training in self-calming and meditation as from the combat. (Fitness Expert)
Trained and worked for years as a Special Forces operator, and came away with advanced combat and survival skills.
Could probably kill everyone in the community without a weapon. Has trouble respecting others because of it.
Fuck with me and I'll kick your teeth in. (Improved Fighting and Cardio.)
I want to show people that this fucked-up world still has some beauty left. (Handy with Arts and Crafts.)
Tell me you're not going to want a nice, warm hat when it gets cold outside. (Handy with Arts and Crafts.)
All this running's tough on clothes. Glad I can patch things up. (Handy with Arts and Crafts.)
I've been writing about zombies for years. Never thought I'd actually run across them. (Knowledge of literature.)
I guess I need a new dance partner. I had to shoot mine the other day. (Improved cardio.)
Taxidermy's a way to take something living and preserve it forever. It's not about dead things; it's about making them immortal. (Chemistry and Arts and Crafts. Interesting combo.)
Don't give me shit for liking cooking shows. My grandma raised me on Julia Child, OK? (Good cook.)
At this point, I'll read just about anything. I draw the line at that sparkly vampire nonsense, though. (Knowledge of literature.)
There's nothing a good bottle of Jack can't fix. Beer pong, anyone?
Sure, I've got a lot of shit stashed. Always knew it would come in handy someday. (Hoarding tendencies.)
Look, laugh all you want, but it's a sport. You ever lug a set of clubs over 18 holes? (Improved cardio, believe it or not.)
I'm never going to be able to watch zombie movies again. Shit hits too close to home now. (Improves cardio slowly.)
I've always loved taking things apart and putting them back together. Dig into the guts, ya know?
I'm going to grab every classic I can...Dickens, Shakespeare, Frost. Losing them would be a tragedy. (Knowledge of Literature.)
I saw Carmen for the first time when I was ten. Gronquist Hall's silent now. (Strong sense of etiquette.)
Shooting targets was fun, but taking out zombies? Now THAT's a freaking blast! (Improved Shooting)
Every item has a history and a soul of its own. Of course, I wouldn't expect someone like you to understand. (Hoarding tendencies.)
One solution. One number per square. It's a rare dose of logic in this illogical world. (Sudoku expertise.)
It's all about the rule of threes. I wouldn't want to be the person responsible for this...if it's a person, that is.
If you ask me, Robert Wilford didn't deserve his 1987 World Mustache Championship victory. Samuel Holt's was MUCH more impressive. (Research experience.)
Give me a snare and I'll bring you every damn zombie in the county. (Improved Cardio.)
Before you ask, no... I don't have sweet nunchuck skills. (Improved Cardio and Fighting.)
Roughing it's actually pretty fun. Fewer zombies would be nice, though. (Improved Wits and Cardio.)
Zombie moans fascinate me. I wonder if they're trying to communicate in some strange, primal way? (Research experience.)
I was unarmed for the first couple of days cuz I didn't want to ding up any of my bats. Had a game-used Babe Ruth, you know? (Sports Trivia whiz.)
This is just like a book I read. Well, like ten or twelve books I read.
You don't sing, do you? (TV Trivia.)
Aw, this reminds me of that one episode... (TV Trivia.)
Sometimes, my nightmares are about Dr. Remoray and his sister. How dumb is that? I mean, I know they were just characters. I'm not one of THOSE people. (Soap opera trivia.)
Never thought I'd miss the paper so much. I used to look forward to that morning thump against my door, but the only ones I hear now are from those things trying to get in.
Damned if the boys weren't gonna win the pennant this year. (Sports trivia whiz.)
That's the difference between us and them. We cook. (Good cook.)
We need to make some armor. (Handy with Arts and Crafts.)
Right about now I'm wishing I'd gotten into horror books. Probably have some good survival ideas in there.
I could be out on the ocean right now. The whole world could go to hell in handbasket, but I'd just have the waves and the wind, you know?
I'm glad I know something useful. (Good with plants.)
Sometimes I still see things...scenes that would make a really good shot, but then I hear those moans.
Wonder if my bros made it. (Decent cook.)
Canned beans are a lot better than I remember. Some cumin and sea salt would really help, though. (Decent cook.)
I always figured I'd die somewhere exotic.
Every day I thank my mom for making me go practice day in and day out. (Improved cardio; fitness guru.)
At least you can get around now without the constant risk of getting plowed into by some jackass in an SUV. (Improved cardio.)
Don't underestimate the value of good socks and insoles. Wicking is really important. (Improved cardio and wits.)
Bob and weave, baby. Bob and weave. (Improved Fighting and Cardio.)
It's only a shame you can't mount a zombie head on account of blasting it all to hell to bag the sumbitch. (Improved Shooting, Cardio, and Wits)
I knew all those hours I spent breaking into my neighbors' houses would pay off someday! (Expert scavenger.)
My body is ready. (Advanced Cardio and Fighting.)
The other inmates used to come to me for all their work. (Tattoo Artist)
A dependable person who can step outside of a situation and make the right call, without getting too emotionally involved.
Can't resist the urge to crack a joke, even at the least appropriate times. Can be a lot of fun ... but can also annoy the shit out of people.
Completely unflappable in the face of danger ... and completely unreasonable in social situations.
I follow a rigorous daily routine that keeps my body in prime condition, and makes it easier to adapt to new threats. (Advanced Cardio, Faster Combat Skills)
My father took teaching jobs all over the world when I was young. I've had to learn to adapt to whatever comes my way. (Increased Wits)
I never realized how important my faith was to me until everything else was taken away.
I never thought I'd be living in a glorified shack, eating beans out of a can. You country people may be used to that, but I'm sure not.
You are just going to have to trust my judgment. (Can be Overbearing.)
Sup, Bro! Beer Pong, anyone?
You lishten to me, hear...I haven't *hic* touched a drop of that shtuff in...um...letsh shee... (Can be Insensitive.)
Oh, quit your whining already. We were all thinking it. I just had the balls to say it. (Can be Insensitive.)
I've always wondered what it's like to put a bullet between someone's eyes... just to see how it feels. Now I can.
I'm just looking out for number #1. You got a problem with that? (Improved wits.)
Cooperation is the key. We have to learn to live together. We have to learn to work together. (Idealistic.)
If you ever need someone to lean on, I'm here for you. We're the only ones left, so we need to look out for each other. (Idealistic.)
You poor dear. You look like you could use a nap. (Idealistic.)
Everything's gonna be alright. (Idealistic.)
Can't we all just get along? (Idealistic.)
Oh...my...gosh. I totally shouldn't tell you this, but I know you can keep a secret. Right? (Gossip. Idealistic.)
People tend to listen when I'm talking. Most of the time that's a good thing. (Leadership skills.)
Misty from Frontier Fun Town...now SHE was a fine piece of ass. Best lap dances in town, too. Wonder what she's looking like nowadays? (Sexting guru.)
Put a little thought into it, and a little can go a long way. (Improved wits.)
Sometimes you gotta go your own way.
Look before you leap.
You lishten to me, hear...I haven't *hic* touched a drop of that shtuff in...um...letsh shee...
If you really need me, I'll be, um...around somewhere. (Hates exercise.)
You gotta be smart to survive. There are no second chances. (Bad at FIGHTING)
Oh...my...gosh. I totally shouldn't tell you this, but I know you can keep a secret. Right?
Oh, damn, sorry. I totally thought you were done eating.
Some people say I'm strange. I think they're the strange ones.
So they say I've got my head in the clouds? Well I'd point out that there's no point in everyone seeing things from the same perspective.
What can I say? I'm a people person. (Sexting aficionado.)
I never really wanted to be big and strong and lug heavy things about... I'm good with it now, though. (Physical powerhouse.)
I never really wanted to be big and strong and lug heavy things about... I'm good with it now, though. (Physical powerhouse.)
People tend to listen when I'm talking. Most of the time that's a good thing. (Leadership skills.)
People tend to listen when I'm talking. Because bad things happen to people who don't. (Leadership skills.)
You gotta fight through the pain. (Max Vitality bonus.)
It's one thing to know how to roll with the punches. It's better if you can avoid 'em all together. (Great reflexes.)
Naturally good shot. (Improves at SHOOTING faster)

DescriptionText.Notes: This line is a reference to the famous Muhammed Ali quote that he'd "float like a butterfly; sting like a bee." It is intended to imply the logical connection between reflexes and melee combat.
DescriptionText.Text: Float like a butterfly... (Improves at FIGHTING faster)
Could trip over a shadow. (Slow to improve at fighting.)
Not the sharpest tool in the shed. (Improves wits SLOWLY.)
I'd rather have a bottle in front of me than a frontal lobotomy. (Improves wits slowly.)
A little trouble focusing. (Improves wits slowly.)
You want me to carry WHAT? (Doesn't handle encumbrance well.)
Deep knee bends are not my friend. Shallow ones either. (Crouching is tiring.)
Running sucks. (Improves cardio slowly.)
Running sucks. (Improves cardio slowly.)
One man's trash is another man's treasure. I can find a way to make a buck off just about anything. (Advanced wits.)
After weeks among the infected, he's decided he's never taking that suit off again. Ever. He sleeps in it. No one knows how he uses the bathroom. (Immune to Bloater Gas and Screamer Cries.)
Cracked ribs. This should heal up in a while. (Health penalty.)
Come back later. (Unavailable)
Come back later. (Unavailable)
Come back later. (Unavailable)
Why are we being so passive?
Haven't been eating right... when I've been eating at all.
(Can't work.)
Hard at work, or hardly working
Give me a minute to rest. (Unavailable)
Come find me now!
Prevents character from being visible in the journal.

NameText.Text: Used to track characters that have become sick in order to allow them to recover during gameplay
Used to track characters that have recently been cured from illness so that they don't get sick again immediately.
Used to track characters that have become hurt in order to allow them to recover during gameplay

DescriptionText.Text: I did what had to be done. But will the Wilkerson's forgive me for it?
I met Eli, the youngest Wilkerson brother, when I rescued Jacob.
If there's one man all of us want to keep alive, it's Doc Hanson.
I've got a few tricks up my sleeve.
Paid a stranger's debt to the Wilkersons. We're all in this together, right?
I couldn't... didn't help him. And then I ran. I've kept running.
Skydiving, base-jumping, mountain climbing... you name it, I tried it. Even swam with sharks once.
I wonder what the hell happened to him? I hope he's still out there somewhere, just straight up picking fights with zombies for shits and giggles.
You know what's sad? I'm already starting to forget what it felt like to be worried about normal shit.
Yeah. Somebody dumped a body right behind my restaurant.
You don't really know how fast a dog can be till it's going for your throat.
And then the dead started rising from the grave and eating people. Fuck it, I need a drink.
And I remember very clearly, there was a moment before it lunged, when I could have bolted for the door to my dad's room, or the door to the courtyard.
Don't know what I was thinking, going out there without backup. Guess I've always bitten off more than I could chew.
I've always felt like I was specially blessed.
How fucking sad is it that I have a better social life after the end of the world?
I been taking care of myself pretty much my whole life. Mom skipped town when I was four, dad was high more often than not.
I lost my virginity behind the football field. Me and Lucy Cormoran, junior year. She had this thing she did where...
And I remember very clearly, there was a moment before it lunged, when I could have bolted for the door to my dad's room, or the door to the courtyard.
Don't know what I was thinking, going out there without backup. Guess I've always bitten off more than I could chew.
I've always felt like I was specially blessed.
How fucking sad is it that I have a better social life after the end of the world?
Think I've seen more of this valley in the past two weeks than I have in the last five years...
People used to hide when they saw me coming. You believe that? Grown-ass men and women, hiding from Santa Claus.
Support local business my ass, once you can order a toilet that's a replica of Henry VIII's throne at two in the morning, you don't go back.
You know what weirds me out about this whole thing? All the toilet paper disappeared in the first few days.
Trust me. I'll never look at the tailpipe of a '72 Falconer Hatchback the same way again.
Hell, now I'm just happy if a can of creamed corn's only been expired a week.
Wouldn't surprise me if this whole thing ends with all of us arrested for trespassing and grand larceny.
It's not exactly a core survival skill, but I am pretty good with a ukelele.
I promptly told them all to get fucked as soon as I turned 18. Moved out here and did my damnedest to forget everything they taught me.

I mean, yeah, the recoil bruises my shoulder and I get dizzy if I run around too long and there aren't any sweet alien hovercraft that totally break the game and never should have been allowed in deathmatch, but still.
Too bad he never got around to explaining the right spot to hit a human being in the head so their skull cracks open like an egg.
Yeah... looking back on it, I should've gotten that dog.
Still. I buried her in that dress. She... she always loved it.
Home theater with a 7.1 surround, fully-stocked bar, jacuzzi in the backyard... it was the ultimate bachelor pad.
Now I'm sharing a room with four other people, and if I want any privacy, I've got to brave the zombie-infested streets.
Wonder what happened to Danny anyways? I was on a supply run in his old neighborhood the other day, didn't look like anybody was living in his family's house.
You know what I hate about living in a small town? Knowing all your goddamn neighbors.
Let's just say that, officially, he'd already turned when I found him.
God, my first place was a shithole. I loved it.

Retrieved Thomas Ritter's watch for Lily. Something to remember him by.
Even though he was dead, it was kind of intense.

I like Quentin, but I'm not going to snoop for him.
Paid a debt for a perfect stranger.
I'm not interested in sharing with strangers.
We have our own problems to worry about.
Made a bad call in the heat of battle that cost lives. Was never officially blamed for the incident, but can't let go of it. Has become extra cautious as a result.
Has been out of contact with spouse and kids since the outbreak began. Constantly dealing with frayed nerves and intrusive thoughts.
Lived on the Gulf Coast as a child, and spent months as a refugee from a terrible hurricane. Learned to be smart and self-sufficient.
Has seen and done things that would freeze the blood of a normal human being. That sort of shit changes you.
